physical_appearance:This is a set of four rectangular photographs. All of them are in black-and-white. The photograph at the top left hand side shows two single-storey houses in a rural area. Kitchen utensils such as pots and pans can be seen from a window. The photograph at the top right hand side also shows two single-storey houses as well. However
 there is a bicycle and several chairs situated outside one of the houses. At the bottom left hand side
 the photograph shows four men standing outside a single storey building. Beside this photograph at the bottom right hand side
 five people can be seen standing outside a single-storey house. Three of them are standing up
 while one of them is sitting down and the other is kneeling and tending to some plants.

sgcool_label_text:A native of Karuvakurichi village
 near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu
 S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying
 handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957
 he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai
 Govindasamy Sarangapany
 Pakkirisami Pillai
 and had friendly associations with them.

metadata.title_text: Appavoo Kandiar’s residence A set of four photographs of Appavoo Kandiar’s residence
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a set of four rectangular photographs. All of them are in black-and-white. The photograph at the top left hand side shows two single-storey houses in a rural area. Kitchen utensils such as pots and pans can be seen from a window. The photograph at the top right hand side also shows two single-storey houses as well. However, there is a bicycle and several chairs situated outside one of the houses. At the bottom left hand side, the photograph shows four men standing outside a single storey building. Beside this photograph at the bottom right hand side, five people can be seen standing outside a single-storey house. Three of them are standing up, while one of them is sitting down and the other is kneeling and tending to some plants.
metadata.subject_terms_1: villages rural houses kitchens general stores workers quarters (districts) dwellings
metadata.subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Villages Singapore Dwellings Kitchens General stores Employees Housing Singapore
metadata.sgcool_label_text: A native of Karuvakurichi village, near Mannargudi town in Tamil Nadu, S. Appavoo Kandiar was a general contractor specializing in pipe and cable laying, handling of cargo and a concrete bricks supplier. Mr.Kandiar was a successful contractor; called a millionaire by the Straits Times in 1957, he owned properties in Bukit Timah and Coronation Road areas. He was a contemporary of Indian pioneers such as P.Govindasamy Pillai, Govindasamy Sarangapany, Pakkirisami Pillai, and had friendly associations with them.
